result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua M Fitch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua M Fitch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Joshua M Fitch.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received an updated offer from the State and requests additional time to review with the defendant.  Court sets this matter for projected guilty plea hearing.  Case adjourned to Br 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua M Fitch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Joshua M Fitch.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received all discover and an offer from the State and requests additional time for negotiations.  Court grants request and sets this for an adjourned Scheduling conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, via zoom.  Defendant Joshua M Fitch not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for Attonrey Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Schdeduling Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State, which is pending review. Defense requests adjourned Scheduling Conference. Court sets deadline of 8/18/2022 for the State to turnover all discovery including body camera footage. Appropriate sanctions may result for failure to turnover discovery as ordered including exclusion of use of certain discovery as evidence.

Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Joshua M Fitch in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Defendant Joshua M Fitch in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF364. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer J. Ruppel.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua M Fitch not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Joshua M Fitch in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Joshua M Fitch in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua M Fitch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  State request to be heard on bail at the preliminary hearing.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
